quizSrc.definition: Performance standards effect all employees in a single position while objectives are unique to the individual.

As manager I want to make sure my employees are focused on their goals and aligned with corporate strategy. Which method would best meet my needs. | Essay. | Forced distribution. | MBO's. | None of the above.

quizSrc.term: Suppose your organization wants to match pay on the external labor market. quizSrc.term: Which of the following is NOT a best practice for compensation surveys, for the purposes of complying with anti-trust law? | Making sure that no one big survey respondent is the main driver of the benchmark data. | Making sure the data are sufficiently old. | Administering the survey yourself.

quizSrc.term: Which of the following is TRUE about pay ranges? | The pay range will give the difference in pay between the least paid person in a grade and the second-least paid person in the pay grade. | The pay range will give the difference in pay between the least-paid person in a grade and the most-paid person in that grade. | The pay range will give the difference in pay between the lowest grade and the highest grade. | The pay range will give the difference in pay between two adjacent grades.

quizSrc.term: When we draw our salary structure, a movement from left to right corresponds to: | A pay reduction, as you're getting a reduction in pay within the same grade. | A promotion, as you're getting promoted from a low grade to a higher grade. | A demotion, as you're getting demoted from a high grade to a lower grade. | A raise, as you're getting an increase in pay within the same grade.

quizSrc.definition: They go through the midpoints of the pay ranges.

quizSrc.term: The pay rates for the jobs that you benchmark are called: | The pay structure's grades. | The pay structure's ranges. | The pay structure's pay policy rates. | The pay structure's control rates.
